description._content: We've utilized YouTube's Quick Capture to create kiosks so visitors can record their own responses. More in the blog. The Black List Project November 21, 2008–March 29, 2009 This exhibition of twenty-five portraits by internationally renowned photographer Timothy Greenfield-Sanders is a documentary project that explores being Black in America. Sanders also directed a series of filmed interviews conducted by noted film critic Elvis Mitchell that will be presented along with the photographs. Serena Williams, Chris Rock, Colin Powell, Toni Morrison, Russell Simmons, Al Sharpton, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, and Sean Combs are among the many African Americans whose faces are seen and voices heard in The Black List Project. www.brooklynmuseum.org/exhibitions/black_list_project/ Using kiosks in the gallery, visitors are sharing their personal experiences related to race and the impact it has had on their lives and accomplishments. Check out the videos on YouTube!
